Reviews.Title: “PH Westgate now Elara, a HGV property - review from Hilton Diamond member”
Reviews.Author: ItMatters1003
Reviews.Content: As Diamond members, we expected a complimentary upgrade from our booked Junior Suite if available. We didn't realize that Hilton Grand Vacations does not operate the same as Hilton in that regard, and we were told that no complimentary upgrades to a better suite could be accommodated (just higher floor). Upon asking what the price would be to upgrade from the Jr Suite to the 1 bedroom suite, we were given one price, which we said no to, then within 5 minutes, the woman checking us in said she would go ahead and give it to us at half price. At that point we took it, but I felt like we shouldn't have had to "price haggle" an upgrade - especially being Diamond status with Hilton. That being said, the upgrade was very worth it and we were glad to pay for it. Huge suite with separate bedroom and separated shower/toilet/dressing area in the bathroom. Extensive ceiling to floor amazing views of Vegas with electronic window shades - one of which (in living room area) doubled as a movie screen. The decor was very contemporary (black and red predominant), with an L shaped leather couch doubling as a queen bed. (Our daughter slept there). Full kitchen is always great to have but there no regular coffee for the coffee pot, only decaf, but the front desk quickly sent some up when we notified them. The bedroom had a nice sized jacuzzi which we were looking forward to using. Upon turning on the jets there was a large amount of black "crud" in the tub rendering it unusable so I had to drain it. I went downstairs to explain and told them to please have housekeeping clean the jets so we could use it that night, and she apologized, assuring us it would be taken care of. Same issue that night - it was very disappointing. There were a few issues that we felt could not be remedied. One was the room temperature. At night, it was absolutely freezing in the living room (where daughter slept) and burning up beyond belief in our room. The next night we opened up our door and it seemed to be a little better, but then we really missed having privacy at night due to the temperature abnormalities. The second issue is the pool. This is by no means a representation of what most pools in Vegas look like (or Hilton pools, in general), whatsoever - extremely small in comparison. The bigger problem is that those staying at Elara no longer can go to the north pool (more resort-like) of Planet Hollywood if the smaller pool is crowded since it's Hilton now, and that was a huge problem because people were out in droves saving chairs starting early in the morning. There simply were not enough of them and I saw many frustrated guests. What was more frustrating was overhearing people staying at other resorts but "tagging" along with friends who were staying at Elara and using the chairs and pool all day. Last complaint is that our daughter (19 years-old) didn't have her key with her to come up to the room where we were (we were on separate flights and didn't arrive together), so security called upstairs to confirm she was with us and then sent her up. There was one other time this happened and a different security guard insisted one of us came down to "claim" her (I think those were words verbatim) even though she asked if he could just call up to the room like last time. He said "Nope, hotel policy" more than once. This was, of course, embarrassing for her and my husband had to go all the way down to get her (elevators were slow due to busy check-in time) Best part of this hotel is location, the room size itself, the valet and cab stand downstairs (very friendly, prompt & knowledgeable) and the fact that it adjoins to the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood's casino (there is none at Elara). There's also a nice happy hour in the lobby bar (there's only 1) from 4-7p with reasonable drink specials ($5 wells) & friendly bartenders. Although this was a less-than-steller property and frankly, not worthy of the Hilton brand yet, we will most likely stay here again in the future, only because of location and our loyalty to Hilton. Our hope is that as time goes on, Hilton will be able to fix these glitches from the property ownership change from Planet Hollywood - they just became HGV/Elara on March 1st.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mhjort
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 night at the Elera and were pretty pleased with it. We normally don't spend much time at the hotel, but having a couch and a small kitchen was a plus. The bed is very comfy Our check in was fast and the staff was friendly, including the maid, who always smiled. Only issue we had, was one day when we came back at 5pm the room wasn't made up. We changed to go out for dinner and on our way out we asked in the lobby if they would make sure it was done until we got back, and it was. So wasn't a big deal really. There is security by the elevators 24 hours a day, which was nice. You have to exit the hotel trough the mall, but if you turn left by the first resturants your out on the street in 2 min. The location is awesome, it's right on the strip and you can walk to everything, and the bus is rigth outside. The internet is $10 a day or $20 for 3 days, which in my opinion isn't that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Audrey H
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Elara was booked for our 30th anniversary by our children. We checked it out on the internet to see what the hotel was like. It had a kitchennete that was supposed to have plates, cups utensils etc. There was 1 knife no cups and small glasses. Had to shop at Walgreen's before we could even have a cup of coffee, which we had to ask for the coffee from housekeeping. Toilet was a joke. Had to flush 2 or 3 times before it would empty. Rain shower took twice as long to rinse off. No ice bucket and thank God we were on the 50th floor as ice machines were located only on the 5th and 50th floor. What gives with that? Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really, a Hilton?”
Reviews.Author: wallace404
Reviews.Content: Gawd, run away from this place. I read the reviews and stayed here for 4 nights and it was awful. Dated room with playboy era style decor. Most all rooms connect so having a quiet night is difficult at best. The hotel has no idea what they are doing yet and the staff is in disarray. No coffee in the morning so you have to walk a mile to get anything. Forget about using your mobile phone in the hotel if you're with AT&T, you will have a very difficult time finding a connection. There are so many better places to stay than the Elara. It was a bad purchase decision by Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: dfourn
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there this week. Wonderful hotel other then the 200$ hold until you check out. Pretty rooms great views and perfect spot on the strip. Right in the middle of everything. Pool, Bar, and Hot Tub are nice along with an outside bar, that you can order from. Check out should be at 11 and not 10. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and room, TERRIBLE guest service”
Reviews.Author: writegrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elara during the National Association of Broadcasters (NAB) at the convention center. First, the hotel is definitely not business friendly. No place to print from a flash drive. Second, our room was never made up (it wasn't made-up when we checked either....should have been a sign), we had to call housekeeping everyday. And third -- the absolute worst -- the housekeeping staff came around in the evening, completely ignoring the "Do Not Disturb - Privacy Please" red light indicator on the outside of the door, and unlocked the door and barged in to ask if we were checking out (huh? Wouldn't that info. be in their computer system?). That happened TWICE. I'm glad we were all dressed! Terrible! I felt violated and it was extremely irritating. We will not be staying at the Elara again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: jumper54
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Elara for 3 days. The room was ok. Customer service was terrible. Started with the check-in, where they could not figure out how to route customers, there were two lines, one for any hiltons member, one for others (both poorly marked). Instead of like an airline where they take people from both lines, they left the people in the non-hilton line to wait with no hope of getting checked in. There was quite a bit of actual yelling and rebellion from this line against the floor manager who was clueless...and eventually realized he had to let people from both lines through. Every service was second rate...definitely not up to Hilton standards. Staff was unaware of what facilities they had...wireless network signup didn't work, had to sit on the line with their tech support to walk them through that they probably had to reboot their router... Staff was unfriendly. Checkout was painful. Points didn't post to Hilton (apparently they are barely associated with Hilton). Everything in the rooms showed a lot of wear...shower curtain was close to falling out of the walls, faucets fell off, door latch looked like it had been forced open, sound system for TV was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Upgrade, Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Melinda R
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I just had a great weekend in Vegas staying at the Elara. Free upgrade to the 1Br suite just by asking at check-in. Didn't have our 2-year-old with us, but it would have been fine as the bedroom, bathroom and living area were all separated by doors. Also great because there isn't a casino in the actual hotel so it is smoke-free and quiet. The pool and elevator access to rooms are only available to guests by displaying a room card, so that was also more private and nice. Room was super clean, very modern. Loved the projection screen television, convection oven microwave and full size fridge. Right in the heart of the strip and connected to the Miracle Mile shops. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jmw3e71
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas once or twice each year, and this was our first time staying at this property. It was booked when the property was the PH Towers, and didn't really think that the switch to HGVC status would be a problem...especially since we are HGVC owners. Oh, so wrong. We are easy-going travelers, have worked in the service industry, and understand that some things just happen. It started when I tried to call the hotel, seeking information about cabana reservations and pricing. In Vegas, of course, reservations can been needed well in advance. After leaving one message, speaking to two separate people, and still not getting an answer on how to proceed with reservations, or any info about pricing, I finally gave up. I called the property itself to see if there were any benefits to being an HGVC owner, and was transferred to a central reservations line, where I sat on hold for a few minutes, only to be transferred again and be told there was nothing. We arrived early on Friday morning, and expected to run into a full hotel...needing to wait for a room to open up. We were with a group and were staying in a two-bedroom suite. As expected, no room ready yet, but they told us to check back in a couple of hours. We went to breakfast, walked around a bit, and called the hotel to check on a status update. I was told by the front desk that they could not tell us over the phone whether or not a room is ready...really? I've stayed at many hotels on the strip that offer to call you when your room is ready. Are we just supposed to keep walking around between 7am and 4pm, walking back every few hours to check-in? The woman at the front desk then told me that it was first-come, first served, based on who was there as the rooms became available. Again...come on! Even though we tried to check in at 7am, if we weren't there at 11am when a room became available, it would go to the next person?? We were able to check in around noon, although we were only able to use half of the room...the one bedroom and common area, as the second bedroom hadn't been cleaned yet. When we were able to go in, the second room had only been partially cleaned. All of the towels were left on the floor, and the trash was still in the room. In the main bathroom, the shower head was broken and only pointed straight down, so anyone taller than 5' 5" would have to duck and crouch under. We had guests sleeping in each bed, as well as the pull out sofa (which was AWFUL!). There were no extra pillows or bedding for the pull out, so we called housekeeping, and were told they would be brought up. Thirty minutes later, nothing had come, so I called to check and was told it would be at least another 30 minutes. Still nothing...so we left, and when we came back, nothing had been brought up. Called again, and were told that the hotel was "out of bedding." We had to call three times on Saturday to finally get bedding and pillows. Then there is the security guarding the elevators...which is more understandable after reading some of the reviews. I would rather be safe than sorry, but after being having absolutely no leniency for our group, then seeing the guard let someone up early Saturday morning without a card, the consistency is annoying. The pool was nice, but you cannot get access to the pool deck (or outside at all) until 10am. No enjoying coffee outside in the morning, no lounging by the pool before it is 95 degrees. After run on the strip, we tried to go out and the security guard very firmly announced that there was no access until 10am because there is no lifeguard. Again...first property on the strip I've encountered that. Long review and rant, and many of these things wouldn't bother me if it had just been one thing, but it was one thing after another, and the hotel staff's total lack of customer service was appalling. p.s. there is no room service or restaurant in the hotel. no coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location not quite yet a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Zeke78
Reviews.Content: If traveling by cab make sure they know it's the old PH towers. Not all cabbies know Elara yet. At checkin didn't have my honors number in system and also had wrong rate. Room is nice very thin walls (luckily it was just a loud tv in the next room). No eating facilities but attached to the mall where there is a Coffee Bean and Starbucks. The planet dailies restaurant in the planet Hollywood casino was nice and not too expensive. Valet parking is tight ( was full the entire tie I was there). Overall great location not bad or great on the rest. If you are looking for a traditional Vegas hotel with casino and over the top ambiance this isn't it

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite Set-Up!”
Reviews.Author: HaleyWoods
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas for a girlfriend's bachelorette party and this was the PERFECT place to stay! Affordable, with a great location connected to the Miracle Mile shops (which turned out to be a great place to meet promoters and get free VIP bottle service at the various clubs we visited). While we were there to get wild, we enjoyed having a room that was a quiet refuge. It even had a full kitchen for our late-night snacks and living room with a pull down projector screen to watch t.v. Everything was modern and clean, though we had to ask the maid service to replace our towels because they didn't do it automatically. Everything else was GREAT. Beautiful views from the floor-to-ceiling windows, and good security (you need to show your room key to get anywhere near the elevators to the private rooms from the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: 21pelly
Reviews.Content: The Good I stayed in the two bedroom suite and it was absolutely beautiful It was nice having the hotel connected to the mall The pool wasn't too bad Location is just about perfect Price was good but we booked when it was PH Towers and was told by other people prices went dramatically up since the name change The Bad We were the only ones trying to check in at the time and it took over 25 minutes. People were rude downstairs at valet Took 3 phone calls for the maids to come clean the room No actual casino (You have to go to Planet Hollywoods)

Reviews.Title: “Planet Hollywho?”
Reviews.Author: wrigmob81
Reviews.Content: We found this place by accident, not knowing that it was formerly the PH Towers. We stayed in the 1Br suite; AWESOME!!!! Though our hot tub wasn't working, they got someone up there within 10 minutes to fix it. The projector screen was off the hook. My only true issue with this place was the parking. If you come back late, you have to park over in the MM parking lot. NOT COOL. Service was great, and being right there next to the MM shops is great. Though Hilton filed bankruptcy; not sure how they're going to do a better job than Harrah's did with this property. I'm hoping they will keep money into this place and keep the cost reasonable. If not, go right across the street and stay at those awesome Signature suites! However, you will NOT be disappointed with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Where were the signs?”
Reviews.Author: Tracey M
Reviews.Content: We were advised two days before we began our holiday that the PH Towers Westgate had changed its name to the Elara Hilton - no issues we thought, we can cope with that! We arrived at the Elara (after driving from LA in our rental car) - we drove to the entrance to unload our bags only to be told we could not stop there to do so unless we were valet parking - we didnt want to do this as we needed to get the car to Hertz Paris Hotel. We explained this to the valet who directed us to the third floor to unload bags and then told us to take the car to Hertz on the eighth floor. My husband let me and my children (and our seven bags) out on the third to check in whilst he returned the car. I was directed by staff to hotel reception though all the Miracle Mile shop and the middle of the casino (it was a VERY long walk), got in the queue to check in only to be told we were in the wrong area and were then directed back through the same way we had come - note there was no offer of help or any sort of trollys available. The Elara hotel entance just looks like another shop on the Miracle Mile (the actual reception area is hidden behind a wall not obvious until you walk well within the entrance) - there were no signs anyway saying it was a hotel let alone its name. My husband finally found us around half an hour later and said there was definately no Hertz area on the floor. We were offered an upgrade to a penthouse suite for a reasonable sum so took it up - turned out to be a great choice as was very luxurious (even if a little tacky in its furnishings). Lack of staff knowledge and signage turned out to be a problem again in our three day stay. We were booked on a Pink Jeep tour of Grand Canyon and were to be picked up from hotel at 6.30am - staff directed us to wrong entrance way - Pink Jeep tours sat at one area whilst we sat at other - lucky for us we had a very experienced guide who decided, before giving up on us completly, to try the back area where we were before we left altogether. It would appear all hotels on The Strip are similiar but we enjoyed the Penthouse Suite experience

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on the strip for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: XO_621
Reviews.Content: Coming to Las Vegas for business is not the first thing one may think of. Saying so you will have to compromise between a fair price and a comfortable stay, especially when you are supposed to be in town for 10 days straight. Looking for a central location at the the strip this can become a challenge or a great disappointment. The Elara Hilton Grand Vacations Hotel became my choice at Las Vegas only after a second glance to what was on offer, as I am not too keen about Holywood Planet locations. To make a long story short: The Elara proved me wrong. Coming into the hotel late after a very long journey over from Europe the first good news was the friendliness of the staff. A observation that was confirmed many more times during my stay. Just great. On top of it as a Hilton Honors member I got an upgrade without any extra cost to a small apartment, looking towards the Paris Hotel and the Venetian. The only sad thing was that kitchen equipment like pots and pans as well as slicing boards and cutting knifes had to be requested from housekeeping. This did not cause too much trouble and so it was an easy fix to the problem. As a HH member I was also entitled of internet access free of charge. Another positive surprise, because usually at least a silver or golden status in the Hilton Honors program me is required to get this. The daily rate for Internet access was supposed to be 9.95$ and a weeks pass at 39.95$. In between also a 3-day pass is available for 17.85$. From the lobby you have direct access to the outdoor pool (open 9-18 daily, depending on weather conditions) and to the planet hollywood mall, which offers not only shopping but also a good choice of restaurants and to the planet hollywood casino. Overall a good choice to stay close to the strip without being at the front line of it. The only thing being a bt strange was the choice of the furniture colors. Being mainly in very dark brown the red sofas and the white kitchen table chairs stick out and may not be the first combination one may think off, but it still nice rather than disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel for a Hilton. Poor security. Poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: Just finished a week in the Elara with a small group of colleagues from work while on business. The hotel has been recently acquired by Hilton Grand Vacations and is not yet up to Hilton standards. I arrived at 1pm and the front desk said that no rooms were available. None of us were allowed to check in until after 4pm. Even on the Hilton Honors high floors the partying and noise when unchecked. Several of us were awakened at night by a man banging on our doors. My colleague's room was broken into while he was in the shower; he lost his wallet, watch, computer and cell phone. Our rental car was stolen from the hotel garage. The crime was upsetting and the hotel's response was disappointing. Our company moved the team to another property for next week.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential but Hilton is failing themselves”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: I had read all the postings prior to arriving in Vegas and was pretty skeptical and assumed that the negative postings about check in we're made by "those that you just can't ever please".... Wow was I wrong! I arrived early afternoon and was informed that it was too early to check in and to return i di so twice before finally encountering at least 30 people in line and another 15 in a Hilton Owners line. There was only 4 people working the front desk ( while that seems like a large number, for a Saturday it was clearly understaffed). Then it got ugly!!!! For the next 60 minutes I stood in line watching all 4 desk clerks attend ONLY to those in the owners line. The result was best described as a near riot. It appears that Hilton is having a problem making their systems fit this new property. Each guest took between 10-15 minutes of processing before they were able to proceed to the room. This is extremely unfortunate since the rooms were amazingly appointed yet appealing to the party crowd has caused the hotel to show some significant wear and tear in a short period. Such a party crowd resulted in the pool being closed one entire afternoon when one rowdy guest threw up in the pool. The walls are paper thin and you will be able to listen to the conversation next door. I am such a faithful Hilton Honors member and loved the bones of the hotel but Hilton really needs to rattle some staffing cages to step it up

Reviews.Title: “Absolute worst customer service I've EVER experienced!”
Reviews.Author: debino
Reviews.Content: Let me just begin by saying that I'm an eaysgoing person who usually never complains but this incident compelled me to finally take a stand! We booked our stay at what was initially Planet Hollywood Westgate Towers only to discover that Hilton had acquired the property a couple of weeks before our stay. The room was great, however when we arrived we were told that the pool was closed for the whole time during our Monday to Friday stay at the hotel. In addition some rooms (not ours) received a note stating that the entire 2nd floor (where the lobby and access to the Miracle Mile shops and the Strip) would be closed for 24 hours. We were assured that "friendly staff" would be present to help us navigate our way around. This unfortunately was not the case. Thursday morning we were told to get off on the 3rd floor go to a 2nd elevator which would take us to the 1st floor which was essentially the parking garage in the basement. We did this and had no clue where we were or how to get to the strip from there. When we asked a staff member from the hotel why we couldn't get off at the 2nd floor lobby (as I had read in one of the notes we were supposed to have received) he stated "I'm not sure but I think you may be able to get off on the 2nd floor (lobby) after all. He told us to wait right there (in the parking garage) and he would go find out and get back to us. Well we waited for 20 minutes and he never came back. We found another staff member and I tried explaining the situation and our disappointment to him and his response was "Just what do you want from me ma'am"! I said I wanted good customer service and directions. He told us in very general and confusing terms go up this way, turn there, etc. I then asked for directions in terms of left and right. This is when he became very rude. He said "I am no longer talking to you", turned towards my husband and said "I will only talk to him"! I asked to speak to a manager and he refused saying he was a manager. I myself am a business owner and cannot imagine ever treating a client in this mannner. Later that evening I called the front desk to ask what the big event was for where they closed down the entire lobby for 24 hours and I was told it was for a "V.I.P. event. I truly think they have got their priorities a little mixed up. As a business owner my V.I.P.'s are and always will be my clients!! Shame on you Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive for Location”
Reviews.Author: scubafan09
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was well-maintained, clean, and half of our suite was extremely glamorous. Our son's interleading suite was considerably less so which was a little strange we felt considering we were paying a lot per night. Ditto re the fact that you are charged daily (be warned!) for EVERY device that you use to access their wireless internet and it's not cheap! Honestly, for the price we paid for the rooms they really should throw in free wireless - even cheap hotels do that. Staff were, as usual on our American travels, great, but to us the big drawback was the huge trek to access the strip from the hotel. Billed as being on the strip it is indeed true that the entrance to the Planet Hollywood complex within which the Hilton is housed is on the strip but there is no mention of the hike to the strip entrance/exit from the Hilton which is right at the back of this massive complex. Live and learn however and next time we'll be more savvy about exactly where on the strip we would want to stay (we thought Flamingo looked just about in the thick of things). TIP 1: We found an unadvertised entrance next to Todai Sushi Buffett to a road which leads directly onto the strip which somewhat shortened our exit. TIP 2: Ask when booking in for the highest room available with a view of the strip. Our check in assistant was happy to oblige. TIP 3: Unless you're particularly flush only connect to wireless with one device .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and experience. Will only ever stay here when I come to Vegas (which is often)”
Reviews.Author: alisombo
Reviews.Content: Having read the terrible comments, I felt compelled to leave a review for this hotel, when it is not normally something I do. To start.. I've stayed in 4 other strip hotels and this was way better than the others.. ( which include two 5 stars). The Hilton have only recently taken over the old PH Towers and their launch party was Thursday 5th April. They had an invite only/ VIP party in the lobby that day and it was a bit inconvenient for guests, but these things happen. The wristband policy which another guest mentioned on their review was not in force during our stay (1st apr to 11 apr). Maybe they've scrapped that idea. If you stay at suites, you have to expect batchelor(ette) parties. They happen. We personally were not bothered by any however. Rooms are spacious and very modern. No problems at all for us, except the housekeeping could have been a higher standard. The shades (controlled on wall) could be stopped at any level by pressing the button at desired height. Bed was extremely comfortable. I did have to call housekeeping for extra linen for our kids in the sofa bed in the living area right enough. Great projector onto the shades, for a home cinema experience. Pool is lovely with very nice loungers and not too crowded compared to some other strip hotel pools. Fantastic suite in a hotel which is in a wonderful location on the strip. Great value for money. Pretty sure management will iron out any initial teething problems and this would be my first choice on the strip any day!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: Agababajaga13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Elara for 4 days and totally loved our view, we had a suite number 5029 and it was very confortable, I do admit it would be great to have a stove to cook cause Vegas is not cheap ,then again, no grocery stores around so...I guess it was fine.New, modern tastefully furnished,we did enjoy it quite a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the Action”
Reviews.Author: CDEW
Reviews.Content: Not bad but far from the action. Hotel was trasitioning owners when we visited. Not bad but would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: rv0511
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night---booked a package deal which included a upgrade to a junior suite for the price of a studio room. Worth every penny paid plus everyone was just so nice and polite. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A good value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: JimPl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Elara Hotel (formerly the PH Towers) in Las Vegas last week (3/28-3/31. I would highly recommend it to anyone. After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant. However, we were totally satisfied with our stay. The staff was friendly, courteous and promptly addressed any of our concerns (eg, one day the maid did not leave coffee for the coffee maker. After a call, we had coffee fixings delivered to the room within 15 minutes.) The room was spotlessly clean, and everything was in good repair. We had the smallest "suite", which was still quite roomy. (We booked the room through Priceline for $80. I didn't expect anything larger.) We had a beautiful view from the 39th floor. The location is great, across from the Civic Center, between MGM Grand and Paris and adjacent to the PH parking garage, especially convenient if you have a car. The elevators were incredibly fast and were always available within 30 seconds. The room was quiet. Security was very good; we needed to show our keycard to an attendant before we could board the elevator. Since it was Spring break time, on Friday and Saturday night we were issued a separate card which had our names and confirmed that we were registered guests before boarding the elevator. We did not use any of the other hotel facilities, but the pool area looked very nice. In sum, I would highly recommend the Elara to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really? PLEASE READ!”
Reviews.Author: Larry S
Reviews.Content: OK so I am (was) an owner of Westgate, now Hilton Grand Vacations Hotel. These rooms were off the hook cool. I stayed there from April 1 thru April 8 of 2012. Scheduled my Vacation back in September. I own a one bedroom Deluxe for a week every other year. Used it last year and it was fantastic! I would have given it a 4 out of 5. This year is way different! To start off with, we get to our room on the 39th floor, and I notice right away that our bathroom door leading in to the living room and our bathroom door leading to the master bedroom have loose handles and there are no way to lock them. Informed the front desk right away. Never got fixed. Also our alarm clock was busted, the television in the bathroom did not work, and there was a hole in the carpet. With what I pay for maintenance fees you would think this stuff would be fixed! Then on Tuesday morning we were making plans to hit the pool when our friends called us (they are owners too) to tell us that they got a letter saying that the pool is closed on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday for a party they are having on Thursday! Are you kidding me? 1. I got no letter telling me this information. 2. I am an owner. and 3. did they not know this in advance enough that they could have let me know before even came to Vegas? My kids love swimming more than any other part of our vacation. Sure they gave us an alternitave. We could walk through the mall and the casino and use Planet Hollywoods pool, but I am a dang OWNER! I should have the use of MY pool! Also. We use the pull out sofa bed for the kids. There are no linens in the room for that bed so we had to call to get some, then when the maid serviced our room on Wednesday she took all the linens for that bed and did not replace them. I just don't get it! On Friday night the room directly across the hall from me had a bachelor party so there was no chance for a quiet night, and I understand that that stuff comes with the territory, but the stench of smoking that I had to deal with that night and the next morning way disgusting in a no smoking facility. They were smoking in the room, and the hall and the elevator area. They left ashes and snuffed out cig's all over the place. I filled out my comment card that is in the room along with a couple extra sheets of paper and turned it into the front desk like it says to do right on the card, and the girl at the front desk turns to another front desk girl and asks "what am I supposed to do with this"? Wow. So in my comments I requested that this problem be resolved with me. So far nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Almost any major hotel on the strip is better”
Reviews.Author: Caribou11
Reviews.Content: Held their VIP opening by blocking off pool, lobby and desk to guests, forcing them to go to rooms and Mile through parkade and alternate elevators with no compensation which gives you an idea of what the organization thinks of paying guests. Almost anywhere on the strip is better

Reviews.Title: “Nice but.....”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful and the junior suite looked awesome ,What a great view.But then came the problems like I tried to fill the large jetted tub but had to abort for two reasons, no water pressure, and no hot water,it was warm thou.But it did have a shower you could bend over and get under a-bit of water.Then to our surprise on our first day we recieved a letter stating the pool would be closed during our stay for a party ,what?How about some sort of a comp,you are taking away what I payed for, and amenities are a reason I chose this hotel.AS a matter of fact I cancelled the great Signature by MGM Thanks.....Oh and the pillows are like rocks....

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: 204Jenny
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's important to note that we planned this trip from where we live in central Canada to Vegas, to celebrate my husband's birthday. We've stayed at the PH Towers Westgate before, and LOVED it - so when we were able to get a great deal a few months ago we excitedly booked there again. A few weeks prior to our trip, I noticed (while checking Tripadvisor reviews, ironically enough) that the hotel was now called Elara and that it was now a Hilton hotel. I phoned right away to ensure that nothing would change with our reservation - the person I spoke with assured me that it wouldn't, and that everything would be the same as it was when it was a Westgate property. It wasn't. Well, the building itself was exactly the same - the ONLY physical changes since it's become a Hilton is the exterior signage and the removal of the little 'PH Towers' pillows on the bed. Nothing has been overhauled - even though in many places it's necessary - and there are still several places where 'PH Towers' still exists i.e. the gift shop bags, the sign inside each room door.....Even though the pool was in fabulous shape, we weren't allowed to USE it because of a 'grand-opening celebration' (we're not exactly sure what there is to celebrate in a situation where a hotel hasn't been revamped or improved in any way). We found this out from a letter stuck in our door the morning after our arrival, instead of from an actual person when we checked in, which is incredibly poor customer service - and a really bad start for a company trying to keep previous customers after a take-over. We were told that we could use the Planet Hollywood pool instead, but if you're familiar with the strip you know that it's a bit of a trek (a 13-minute walk - we timed it) to get from PH Towers to the Planet Hollywood pool - a complete pain in the a$s if you already have a perfectly fabulous pool in your own hotel. Then, on the night of the grand-opening celebration, all of the hotel guests were deviated from the usual lobby route to another floor/other elevators if they wanted to get anywhere, which was also an imposition when you're on vacation and want things to be smooth and relaxing. One other interesting piece is that when we checked in, the front desk employee took the $20 I gave him for an upgrade, yet didn't upgrade us. We had the same room we had booked in the first place! (so why didn't he just tell me that he couldn't help us out, and let me keep the $20?) WE WILL NEVER STAY AT ELARA AGAIN. All of that being said, the elevator staff was fantastic - you honestly couldn't ask for nicer or more professional people - and our housekeeping staff was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room was nice but other problems...”
Reviews.Author: marianne j
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister, her husband and I stayed at the Elara this past week. We had a beautiful room and views. The room service was not great, but we were fine and when we called they were very quick and responsive. But on Thursday of our stay as we returned to our room after breakfast, we realized that the Hilton executives were going to celebrate purchasing the hotel. To our dismay, the pool was closed, we were escorted thru a side door and side elevators to our room. We found this to be very demeaning to the people on vacation. We were leaving Las Vegas last night and had planned to sit at the pool in the early afternoon. We were told that we should have received a notice about the "party for the executives" which we did not. In talking with other people, they did not receive any notice either. I think the executives should have used the side elevators and the pool should have remained open for everyone. By celebrating the purchase, who better to celebrate with then the people who are on vacation and paying to stay at their hotel. Although the place was very nice, we will not be visiting any Hilton's anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative people”
Reviews.Author: acvmuniz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife March 25-27, Sunday thru Tuesday. Stayed on the 38th floor in a 1 bedroom suite with great views of Paris Hotel. After reading some of these negative reviews about check in here and other issues, I was hesitant on visiting this hotel. But after our trip I am of the opinion that the people who wrote these reviews are just negative people and nothing will satisfy them.. We arrived around 4 pm for check in and the only issue that we were confused on since this was our first time here, was where to park for this hotel. This hotel shares its parking with the Miracle Mile mall and bigger signage would help the first timer. Check in line was non existent and less than 5-10 minutes got our keys and headed upstairs to our room. Our room was huge compared to similarly priced hotels on the strip. Also since this is a non smoking hotel we did not have to smell any lingering smoke from past guests. Our room was clean and spotless. My wife and I usually wipe down remotes, light switches, etc. at other hotels but this hotel was so clean that we did not feel the urge to do that here. Service was excellent, we called the next day for more towels and within 10-15 minutes there were at the door with them, no problem at all! The walk from our room through the mall to the strip was less than 10 minutes. But there are a lot of things to see and restaurants in the mall that we only made it on the strip once during our stay here. Walking to the Planet Hollywood Casino was a little closer and also had many good restaurants. We tried room service here and it was excellent! So good we had it both mornings! Best part was laying in our bed at night looking out of our window at the Eiffel Tower! We would stay here again, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, be warned!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: Place is a hole. Toilet leaked, shower not working. Got room changed, there was dirty underwear in the bathroom. Had a loud party across the hall, they tried to kick the door in. Called security, they did not come. Stayed her 12 months ago. It WAS good. Now it's just a run down stink hole. With Mexicans that can't clean to save them selves from deportation.

Reviews.Title: “Poor follow through and communication”
Reviews.Author: June R
Reviews.Content: Positive: nice upgrade from studio suite to 2 bedroom condo. Pool nice. Great if just going for shopping and don't want to be connected to a casino. Just off strip but in middle so easy walking distance to many casinos. Minor issues: lightbulbs burned out, temperature regulation needs improvement. Negative: unfortunate incident of having my purse stolen from my room while we slept. Poor follow through and communication from security. Security does not work weekends! WOW! No even superficial follow up or through to assure our safety. Did not even provide for me documentation to take to airport-I had no identity-it was all taken! Talked with two managers with no success or any changes. Disappointing at best if you have any concerns with safety!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experiences of our lives. Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: jvevil
Reviews.Content: Wow....Where do I start. First I'd like to add a little credibility to my review by stating I've stayed at over ten Las Vegas hotels (all strip hotels minus the HR) and never once have I experienced such terrible service and ridiculous policies. I'm also a timeshare owner (thank god it's not Hilton) and have stayed at other vacation ownership properties. I strongly urge anyone considering a stay here to book elsewhere. Let me start with day one. When you arrive at Elara via cab you will be dropped off at the cabstand which is on level one. You'll have to take an elevator or escalator to level two while carrying your luggage. If a room is not available you will have to carry all your luggage back downstairs to the cabstand area where the bellhop will take your luggage. What's up with this? No bell desk on the same level as the lobby? If the previous developer screwed this up the least they could do is provide bellhops in the lobby area with luggage carts. This would be an easy remedy if Elara had a competent management team that cared about their guests. We finally made it to our rooms later that day and unpacked. We were changing our clothes when a maid entered our room. She walked half way down the hall and realized we were in the room. She never made it all the way into the room and she apologized as she was leaving. An honest mistake but c'mon people. Did you not know this room was occupied? It's not like it was an early check in. The room wasn't anything special. Sure it was larger than an average hotel room but big deal if you have to deal with incompetent hotel staff. Some negatives about the room: one of the bathroom door locks did not work, the freezer was completely frosted over, telephone in the bedroom did not work, one tall glass missing, no full length mirror, no coffee pot (c'mon, a vacation ownership property with no coffee maker?), and the blinds were a bit annoying. They had the cool factor since they could be opened and closed with the touch of a button but there was no inbetween setting. They either had to be fully opened or fully closed. I understand these aren't deal breakers but wanted to point them out to future guests. During our first night we were awakened on three separate occasions by our telephone ringing. We would answer it but nobody would be on the other end. It made for a wonderful first night of sleep. The biggest complaint I have is with their wristband policy. Yes you read that right. Wristbands!!! They implemented the most ridiculous policy during our stay. We were returning to our room the second day when the security guard at the elevator told us we would have to get a wrist band before going to our room. Our jaws dropped. Are you serious Hilton? You expect grown adults to wear a wrist band in Vegas? I can understand a wristband policy for clubs and pools and all inclusive resorts but to get to my hotel room in Las Vegas? Do you think people want to be wearing a wrist band while dressed up and eating out at nice restaurants? Do you think people want to be wearing a wrist band in all their Las Vegas pictures? Do you think people want to sleep with wristbands on? This policy needs to go away NOW!! If you had competent managers you would have never started this policy. I understand you sometimes have guests inviting non-hotel guests over for parties but you deal with these issues on an individual basis. You do not implement a blanket policy for all your guests when it is such a ridiculous policy. My wife and I were so angry we would have checked out if we didn't only have one night remaining. BTW, they have to physically put the wrist band on your wrist and you cannot take it off since they will only issue one extra band to the main guest on the reservations. BTW, the line for the wristbands was about fifty people deep. They wanted every guest to stand in a long line to get wristbands. I can't tell you how many angry people we met in the hotel after this policy was implemented. I can tell there were a lot of complaints because the entire hotel staffs attitude changed overnight. They all became rude. I don't think the staff wanted anything to do with this policy but had no choice in enforcing it. BTW, the security guards at the elevator were also rude while trying to enforce this policy. It was just a very bad idea from the beginning and I can't believe anybody in the hospitality business would even think up such an asinine policy. I called the front desk to ask for a manager so we could discuss the policy but one wasn't available and my message was never returned. I also asked for a manager at the front desk but once again they weren't available. How convenient. I had high hopes for this hotel but it failed us on every level. We will never be staying at Elara again and we will go out of our way to inform future guests and property owners of Hiltons poor service. We will never stay at any Hilton owned properties and hope Hilton gets their act together for the sake of their vacation owners. Elara scores a giant F-

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Carla T
Reviews.Content: Words to the wise: -Check on your reservation numerous times, the hotel likes to cancel bookings for no reason -Don't expect an email confirmation of your reservation, you won't get one -Get ready to have $100 per room added to your bill in incidentals, front desk & phone reservation operators do not mention this - DO NOT turn on the jacuzzi tub unless you want remnants of the past guest blasted at you - DO NOT try to call housekeeping they won't answer the phone, or the front desk after hours for that matter - DO NOT expect any actual help from the concierge, inept is a kind statement - DO NOT expect to be treated with any level of competence, concern or have a level of effort shown to correct any problem Shame on you Hilton for not valuing your customers, and putting someone off your brand of hotels for life.

Reviews.Title: “For the price it was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Mariah04
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a penthouse with 3 bedrooms. Had to book 2 bedrooms and one bedroom. was given a great deal but in order to get them together we had to upgrade to the penthouse and pay $200 more a night! It had a lot of room, was nice. Smelt like a sewer on saturday (but so did part of the miricale mile). Bed was very comfortable. The towels also smelt a bit odd too. Kithchen had a stove top, frig, cups, coffee maker, all the little things you need to have a good time. LOVED the living room area! Overall again, for the price we got compared to the other penthouses in Las vegas was an amazing deal. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, value, and location”
Reviews.Author: LGinMD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at Elara for the second time. On our first visit, and when we booked this trip, it was called PH Towers, but the ownership changed after we booked the trip. We got a great deal that included an upgrade to a suite--definitely the way to go! The room was enormous, with 5 TVs, a jacuzzi in the room, and a large kitchen. The hotel is located center-Strip (great for if you don't rent a car), very close to City Center, Bellagio, Paris/Ballys, Trop, and MGM. It's a short walk through the Miracle Mile shops to get to the Strip, which I actually prefer over having to navigate through a huge, smokey casino like you do at most hotels. These hotels (PH/Elara) cater to a younger crowd--seemed like most people here and in the casino were mid 20's-30's--and the restaurants/shopping were all more reasonably priced than other mid-Strip casinos like Aria and Bellagio. No trouble checking in early or checking out late, and excellent room service. We would definitely stay here again, especially if we get another good online deal.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites for a pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: Zach989
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party back in February (when it was still PH Towers), and we had the two bedroom suite. Our rate came out to be about $430/nt for President's Day weekend, which didn't seem to bad for how big this suite was. The good: - Full sized fridge with filtered water and ice - A projector that turns the blackout shades into a giant screen - Dishwasher for cleaning cups - Overall a big room. Fits 8 people very comfortably - Some good and inexpensive food options in the Miracle Mile mall downstairs. And ABC stores for buying only slightly overpriced booze The bad: - Two of the four beds are pullouts - They don't give you enough sheets and blankets for all the beds off the bat; you have to ask housekeeping for them. And some of those mattresses are pretty gross - Overall, the room was a little banged up. You can tell it's a party room, and they don't do too much maintenance on them - The granite table is incredibly heavy to move for drinking games. And that chandelier is directly at head level. Ouch - The blackout shades' motor stopped working the last night in one of the rooms If you're going to Vegas with a fairly big group, this is definitely a good option. It only came out to be about $30 more a night than getting two individual rooms, but you get the bigger kitchen. Plus, it's pretty moderately priced for being on the Strip. Oh, and tip: if you unplug the white cord from the wall behind the speaker box, you can plug in an iPod for playing music.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Brent R
Reviews.Content: First off, if you are there for any sort of sporting event, you have got to get this suite. When we booked it, we didn't even know that it had a floor to ceiling projector screen.(I'll upload pics) We spent a Lot of time in our room because of this! The bedrooms were really cool. The beds were huge! One of the bedrooms had a couch that could fold out into a bed, and the other had a chaise that at least one of us crashed on at random times, and that bedroom had a giant jacuzzi in it too, as well as a washer/dryer in the bathroom. The main living area of our 2-bedroom suite had 2 couches(one fold out) and a kitchen that was stocked with dishes and silverware. The view was awesome, and at night I could've spent hours just looking out the window. The walk to Planet Hollywood is a little long the first couple of times, but you get used to it, and who keeps track of time in Vegas anyway? This does appear to be a party place, because the people in the room next to ours had music going at ALL hours. We keep such a random sleep schedule when in Vegas though, it didn't bother us too much. All in all, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Jmpf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2011 liked it so much we came back, not disappointed. Three of us stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, plenty of space, great views and value for money compared to room prices in the major strip hotels. Location is centre of the strip, adjoining Miracle Mile Shops (best in Vegas in my wife's opinion and she know her shops!!!!). There is a pool onsite but no other facilities of note which isn't a problem as everything else is on your doorstep at Planet Hollywood, Paris, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan and Bally's. No problems on check in and check out. Nice to see security staff checking guests for access to the elevators, housekeeping was good. Suite was modern, large, good design, floor to ceiling windows, hot tub in bedroom, full kitchen. Our friends stayed in a studio suite, just as good. Also, no problem on check in for staff to make sure we got rooms on the same floor. Nothing negative to say, will be checking in to toe Elara on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “top tower”
Reviews.Author: ANDIJIM
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week at the Planet Hollywood Towers (or now know as the Elara). Had a brilliant time. Hotel in an excellent location for the strip. The room was amazing...we had a 1 Bedroom King Suite. Jacuzzi in the room big comfortable bed. The view for the room was incredible, you could see the strip the airport and mountains all from the same window. The room had a washing machine/dryer a microwave a massive fridge with chilled water and ice machine, hairdryer, and 5 TV's.!!!! All mod cons supplied. There was also an iron and ironing board in the room. The hotel pool was also nice although a little windy when we stayed. They also provide towels for the pool area. We were lucky in as much we had 2 brilliant tour guides ...the couple we went with had been numerous times before...they also took us to a new museum in downtown Vegas called The Mob Museum worth a visit. We also flew Virgin Atlantic and they made us feel very comfortable. Vegas is so well worth the trip make sure it's on your list of places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the 2 bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: richknebel
Reviews.Content: Short & sweet review: -BIG room -Great having the kitchen to sit & eat/drink at -High end feel, fancy rooms & bedding Cons: Still a long walk to the strip compared to Planet Hollywood (have stayed in both now) only downside, is a 10 minute walk to the strip.... if that is an issue. Didnt bother me this time that much, because this was my 7th stay in vegas and we didnt hit the strip as much as someone coming for the first time would be.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great views”
Reviews.Author: Pghproud412
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Planet Hollywood Towers. The huge projector TV is great and having the kitchenette and table was extremely useful. This is a great location, just off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan W
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on here I booked rooms at the Planet Hollywood Towers. Many people have complained about cleanliness, our room was spotless and the king size bed was very comfortable, besides if you go to Vegas to hang out in your room then you picked the wrong destination. The pull out did leave a little comfort to be desired but after walking around, drinking, and gambling all day you dont even notice it. Having a refigerator and glasses for shots/drinks was very nice. We got a free upgrade just for asking, I even tried to tip the clerck at check in $20 but she gave it back to me!!!! We put 4 and 5 people in the rooms and had plenty of room, we were basically asked at the desk how many keys we needed and were handed them with no problem. It is kind of annoying that you have to show your key to get on they elevators every time but it's not that big of a deal. I would recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: castro_boom
Reviews.Content: the room was very comfortable and had really cool decorations, the service was whatever. I was offer an upgrade to the top floor for a chance for a better view but 15% of the view was blocked by other buildings and 50% of the view was to parking structures and back streets. It does not have a casino or restaurants but is connected to the miracle nice which makes it nice because it sort of gives it direct access to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Planet!!! Will return!!”
Reviews.Author: Diorgirl71
Reviews.Content: On arrival approx 7pm on a Wednesday, we walked straight to the desk, where we were greeted by Carlos, very cheerful helpful and courteous. My husband explained that it was my birthday and our 1st Anniversary (it genuinely was), we had booked the 1 bedroomed suite, he had a look and got us an amazing room on the 28th floor, with fabulous views over towards, Paris, Bellagio fountains, Wynn and Encore. The suite had everything...immaculate, luxurious, accommodation. We spent 3 nights here, great access immediately from miracle Mile shops, which has lots of shops and eating places..Great location, central strip, has the perfect mix for a great stay...A special thank you to Carlos, who helped us sort out a problem we had with our cards and was extremeley professional!!! Would highly recommend PH Towers/Westgate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size, although the deocr felt a little dated. The kitchenette was nicely equipped. We had a nice view of the pool. The lights were not working well and the sound-proofing between rooms could be better. We were informed upon check-in that it had changed ownership to Hilton. While we were given the chance to sign up for HHonors Rewards, we did not get any other discounts or coupons that other hotels offer. The staff (both desk and housekeeping) were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty B
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here in a 2 bedroom suite and were blolwn away be how amazing the suite was. We were on the 54th floor and had an incredible view of the stip through the full height windows.The location is great and the proximity to the shops, restuarants and bars within the Miracle Mile was a bonus! As well as a full kitchen and a spa bath, we also had a washing machine/dryer which was a blessing since we had been travelling for three weeks by that stage and had accrued plenty of clothes the needed to be washed! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hot Spot”
Reviews.Author: gthomas108
Reviews.Content: Stayed Valentine's weekend. Staff was great, Terry who checked us in was awesome. Room was unbelievable 1br suite with a view that was breath taking. We definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: shadowsjc
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a 3 night stay at the Hilton Elara (formerly PH Towers). I had booked a deal on the old PH Towers website: pay for a Studio Suite (standard room) and get a free upgrade to a 1 BR Suite. At present, the Hilton website has a similar deal, but the upgrade is only to a Junior Suite. I was a little worried that my reservation would get mixed up due to the PH -> Hilton switchover, but luckily those fears were unfounded. Arrival I arrived in a rental car, and there was free parking adjacent to the lobby. As you enter from the bottom floor, you take an escalator up to the 2nd floor which is where the lobby is. The hotel has a sleek/modern decor (compared to some of the more "luxury" decors at Venetian/Wynn). Check-in was easy and we were able to get our rooms at 1pm even though check-in was at 4pm. Rooms - 10/10 We had two separate 1 BR Suites; one on the 19th and one on the 20th. Both had nice views; one faced south towards the pool area and the MGM Grand, and the other faced north towards Paris, PH, and Ballys. The rooms were GREAT. Spacious living room and kitchen area, complete with a big leather couch, full sized fridge, and a table with seating for six with a flat screen TV on the wall over the table. The living room had floor to ceiling windows, another flat screen on the wall, and shades that came down at the push of a button. The real kicker was the HD projector mounted on the wall that used the shades as the screen. In essence you had your very own mini theater right in the room! We watched various sports games on this screen, and it's something I've never seen in any other hotel room. The bedroom was also spacious, with another flat screen TV, ample closet space, and a mini jacuzzi in the room. Finally, the bathroom had two sinks, a separate toilet area, and a shower stall. The bathroom was connected to both the living room and the bedroom, although there were two doors. There was even a washer/dryer in the bathroom under the sink. The rooms were large enough to easily accommodate 4 people, although we only fit 3 and 2 in the rooms. Facilities: 8/10 There was a gym which members of our party used (I did not); they mentioned it was sufficient, but lacked things that you would find at a larger fitness facility (such as an ab machine). The pool area was nice, but not as "fun" as other Vegas pools I've visited. They also had a bar out near the pool area which I didn't try. The lobby bar was also pretty nice, and I caught glimpses of a few sports games as I walked to other parts of the hotel. Location: 9/10 The hotel is adjacent to the Miracle Mile shops, which is an assortment of clothing and food stores between the Elara and the Planet Hollywood Casino. We had lunch in the complex a couple of times and it was pretty convenient. The Planet Hollywood casino is about a 6 min walk through the indoor mall. The hotel itself is across the street from the Cosmopolitan, although it's a bit tough to get there directly due to the Strip crossings (you have to go up escalators, then walk across, then down). It's easier to walk north towards Ballys and cross the street there. Other thoughts The listed checkout time is 10am. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I expected to be able to check out a little later, especially since we checked out midweek when there's less demand. However, it was a bit of a struggle to get the checkout moved; we were asked to call the front desk at 7am, which would have defeated the purpose. Eventually we did get the checkout moved, even though it took a little back and forth. There was a hotel worker by the elevators checking room keys. It was kind of annoying at first but I guess they want to keep the rooms safe. Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel for a younger crowd (Spring Break / Bachelor / Bachelorette / Bday party. It's in a pretty central location and good for a younger crowd. Fun times and I would consider it next time I'm in LV

Reviews.Title: “Vegas in the Springtime”
Reviews.Author: Janice V
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had bought into the Planet Hollywood Towers before they opened in 2010. This is the first opportunity we had to go and found out just before we left that the property was now managed by Hilton. Arrived on Friday at 11 and told to come back at 3:30 as there were special floors for the owners and nothing was ready yet on those floors. We went over to the Planet Hollywood casino and had a quick lunch at PF Changs and when we got back there were lines, separate for Hilton Honors club holders, they went pretty quickly and when we got up to the desk they were very helpful and gave us lots of information on what was going on with the change. He has a one bedroom suite and studio suite connected and we booked the entire unit thinking some friends might join us but didn't at the last minute so we had the whole place to ourselves. Wow, when we got to the rooms,they were spectacular! Full kitchen with a sit down table for four when you come into the one bedroom. A great view out of floor to ceiling windows with a leather sectional that you can watch one of the many flat screen televisions that are everywhere or choose to put down the shade that doubles a projection screen (15'x10') in the living room. The bedroom is spacious and has a large jacuzzi tub next to the bed as well as separate stalls for the shower and toilet. Also a floor to ceiling window for great views from anywhere in the room. There is a small washer/dryer built into the vanity in the bathroom for underwear or small items (if you can figure out how to use it) also the standard hair dryer and magnifing mirror mounted to the wall near the sink. The studio had a kitchenette with a small refrigerator and microwave when you walk in, large closet with safe same floor to ceiling windows with view, very spacious bathroom with separate toilet stall and a jacuzzi tub and shower combo. In both rooms there was a blender and toaster in the kitchen as well as stocked cabinets with anything you could need to cook in the rooms. It was decadent but nice to have both units to spread out in. Very deco/Hollywood vibe furnishings and artwork but comfortable and great mattresses but terrible foam pillows. The pool area was open and the pool is heated but we didn't have time to enjoy it this trip. Overall, great location, accommodations and service. The down side was a very young, hard partying group when we were there (the larger suites are perfect if you want to have parties or are staying as a group) so the halls are full of noise all night long. We were told that there are special floors for owners that have special amenities (like the fully equipped kitchens) so ask what is included if you are a "transient" as they call anyone who is not part of the timeshare staying there. I would recommend it highly! We had a great time, now if only we could have won a jackpot or two that would have made it perfect! One other thing, there is no affiliation to any casino now so that means no comps from the Planet Hollywood casino can affect the rooms here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: TiffAnnRT
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at PH Towers-Westgate May 2011 and LOVED it! The building was beautiful! The pool was AMAZING! Our room was very clean and roomy. We did have some noisy neighbors on Friday night...but it's Vegas...we just slept with the TV on to drown out the noise. The staff was great & check in was quick. An added bonus...we were able to get in our room at 11am, no waiting. Loved the place & the staff :) Definately worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: englishteacher_11
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas in January for a wedding. We made a reservation for the Planet Hollywood Towers through a travel website that we had never used. We were cautiously optimistic. We had visited the Strip several times and knew that the location of the Towers would be perfect for this trip. The room was as good as the location! Although we did not have a Strip view, the floor to ceiling windows still provided a good view. The room could have used a thorough cleaning, but it was neat and well equipped. It even had a small kitchenette with dishes and utensils. We would probably stay at the PH Towers again and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: James133
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PH towers 2/9-2/12. In the past year I stayed at Harrah's and the Flamingo. So my review is partially in comparison to those two stays. I thought the PH towers were very clean. This was a nice characteristic in comparison to my last two stays. I did however think the rooms were small. We stayed in the studio condo floor plan. I guess I didn't do as much research as I should have but I assumed that a condo would have a bedroom. I booked through a third party and didn't realize that a studio condo was an option. I had just saw the one and two bedroom condo floor plans. Just incase anyone else has any confusion on what a studio condo is, it is a hotel room with a few plates and bowls, a tiny fridge and a dishwasher. The location of the PH towers is ok. It is a little further south than I like but I like to be next to O'shea's and Casino Royal where I can play some table games with lower minimums. The food is was pretty good. It was a little chilly for the pool but one day it was in the 70's and seemed like it could be a good time in a few months. I did learn that you can't use the Planet Hollywoods pool if staying at the PH towers since they are two seperate entities. My favorite attribute of the PH towers was the convenient shop down in the miracle mile mall. You could get decent priced bottles to cut down on your liquor bill for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Forget The Rest Stay At The Best (part 2)”
Reviews.Author: funtime_frankie_11
Reviews.Content: This is the second review i have wrote in six months about ph towers. This time i had a 2 bedroom suite on the top floor. OMG! My friends were blown away on just entering the room straight infront full view of the eiffel tower of paris and beyond the bellagio fountains. The room had a projector tv and 4 other large screens, jacuzzi, 2 bathrooms and it was immaculate for the whole six days we spent there as room service did a great job. Not to mention the kitchen and large fridge that dispensed ice and refreshing cold water ideal for a hangover. Ph towers may not have a casino but this is the best thing about the place no smelly cigarette smoke and drunk people as you attempt to go to your room and there are plenty of casino's within a stones throw if you enjoy a flutter. The nice walk through the miracle mile shopping centre to the strip is immaculate and offers some lovely food. I can not fault this place at all! Do not stay anywhere else in vegas as I will stay here every time I visit this fantastically mad town.

Reviews.Title: “Opened the door and thought "Wow!"”
Reviews.Author: Andypf
Reviews.Content: Staying 4 nights during the week, I had a massive one bed room suite at the PH Towers for under $100 a night! For that, I got an apartment with full kitchen / lounge room, seperate bedroom (with king bed and hot tub), TVs in every room (including bedroom, lounge room, bathroom and kitchen, plus in the lounge room the window could turn into a huge screen with a projector for movies), and views of Paris hotel and the Eiffel tower. Having been travelling for a few weeks, a washing machine/dryer in the room also saved a lot of money on hotel laundry service! The PH Towers are attached to the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood casino. The short walk through the shops to the strip is probably on par with th distance of most of the other big hotels, so wasn't a big deal. Located right next to Paris, across from the Bellagio its a really central and convenient location. The only down side was that house keeping could have been a little more through. It wasn't filthy or anything like that, but small things that had been obviously been missed that really should have been clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious hotel with easy access to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveler00
Reviews.Content: The Planet Hollywood Towers is a very nice hotel with easy access to the strip. The Towers are connected to the Planet Hollywood Resort by the Mircle Mile Shops which is a mall of sorts. A 6-7 minute walk from the Towers puts you on the strip. We were in the Two Bedroom suite which is really a one bedroom suite with a connector room. The rooms are extremely spacious and well appointed. The highlight is the humongous projector screen in the living room. Check in/check out was quick and easy. The pool at the Towers is very nice and was packed during the day. Overall my stay here was a great experience. My only complaint would be with housekeeping. The room was not very well cleaned prior to our check in. Some left over trash was in the cans and several items left by previous guests remained in corners or sides of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Kalby10
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on March 1st (1st day Hilton took over the PH Westgate Towers) for a 3 night stay. Our flight landed in the morning and made it to the front desk around 11am, when I spoke with the girl at the reception area she informed me that check in was at 4 and they didn’t have any open rooms at that time. We were able to check our bags at the bellhop and venture around the strip waiting to check in. I arrived back to the front desk around 2PM and approached the same girl at the check in, she was polite and remembered me from earlier that day. As she checked her computer for open rooms I explained to her that we booked a 1 bedroom suite but was hoping to get into a 2 bedroom since there were 3 of us staying. As she looked I handed her my ID and credit card with a $20 in-between. Without saying anything she took the 20 and pocketed it. After a few more minutes she asked if the 2 bedroom penthouse would be okay! Getting off the elevator we had a long way to walk because our room was at the very end of the hall. After opening the double doors to the penthouse we were greeted to an amazing view from the floor to ceiling windows in the living room. Both master and the 2nd bedroom were huge and offered plenty of space for 6-8 people. The master was situated on the corner of the building and offered floor to ceiling windows on 2 walls. The bathroom had an amazing Jacuzzi sitting right on the windows over looking the strip. This room was so nice it made it hard to leave (not bad for under $200 a night). We called for our bags when we walked in the room, they were delivered within 10 minutes. Maid service was also very good, they came every day and even asked every time I saw them in the hallway if they could get anything for us. The hotel itself is situated perfectly just off the strip but connected to the mall. This allows guests to walk to the PH casino or the strip without having to exit the hotel. We didn’t use too many of the hotels amenities but we did sit by the pool on 2 afternoons. The staff was very nice, offered us towels, and checked a few times to see if we needed anything additionally. The only negative thing I can even think of is all the furniture is black and shows a lot of dust even if its is cleaned every day. All in all this was a great place to stay and next time I am in Vegas I will be staying at the Hilton Elara.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at PH Twrs, now Elara”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights (in Sun, out Thu) with the pay-for-studio-get-a-one-bedroom deal. Was assigned 21st floor facing north. Wouldn't want much lower - since you look down on parking garages. However, the view was hotels including Paris and a glimpse of Bellagio fountains. We checked in at 11pm Sunday; no problem. Room didn't have sofabed sheets - but those arrived within 10 minutes of a call. Next day, we called because the safe was locked (by previous guests). Security had that resolved quickly. Also got quick service when we couldn't find any dishwasher soap. Our kitchen had a setting for 4. A can opener; no other utensils. No toaster. Called about the toaster (since another TA review mentioned one), but found out that's not standard. Microwave is a challenge to program until you get the hang of it. Seems it's also functions as standard oven. Pool is more for show than swimming. Parts are labelled as 9" deep. Looks like it was built to generate money; there are two floors of cabannas. There is one hot tub. I'd agree with the reviewer that the fitness room (4th floor) looks like they ran out of money. I walked around - but didn't use. A few flat panel TVs, but I didn't notice any screens built into cardio equipment. Changeroom has one shower. No sauna or hot tub there. Liked - projection TV, music stations through TV - dishwasher - buttons for privacy, cleaning service - double bathroom sinks - spacious living area - modern lighting and decor throughout - security checking for room cards by elevators Didn't like - no bathroom fan; black toilet - sofabed mattress is basic quality - no pots/pans (although no pots/pans was identified in the PH Twrs website) - cabbie taking us for a ride (via hiways) $25 before tip from LAS - all the salespeople approaching you when you walk through the mall March 1 2012, this property became "Elara, a Hilton Grand Vacations Hotel".

Reviews.Title: “2 Bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: KYM123
Reviews.Content: The view in this room it pricelss! They have a projector that drops down as curtains, a full kitchen, a washer & drying, & a jacuzzi. The room was large with an L shaped couch. The down side: small closets, room & bathrooms need more lighting, & the biggest downside we had: there was no spatula & only 1 pot & pan. This was our biggest downside because we had a lot of people in this room & 1 pot & pan was not cutting it to cook for everyone. The no spatula thing might be small, but you can't really cook eggs without one. The sink in the kitchen also didn't have a grinder, so you had to pick everything out so it doesn't clogged. I've stayed at the signature MGM & their kitchens have EVERYTHING you need & more! They have these large bowls so you can service large dishes & more than ONE pot & ONE PAN. They have free valet too & great customer service! The best part, all for about the same price! They're right across the street from PH towers too! So really, there's no down side to the signature MGM! Also, when booking the 2 bedroom, we wanted to book an additional room to connect, but we were told that we cannot book 3 bedrooms suites. We can only ask for it when we check in. Kind of weird! I would know I work for a hotel in San Diego. Especially weird because the 2 bedroom we got had connecting doors to not just for 1 more additional room,but for 2! So we could have had a 4 bedroom suite! So overall, the room was nice & beautiful, but when I compare to where I've stayed before (Signtaure MGM), it just doesn't compare!

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's Opinion - Huge Rooms, Limited Amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
